p: Berberis thunbergii DC. is a dense spiny shrub that was introduced from Japan as an ornamental plant in 1875 [ 27], but it did not become feral in the Northeast U.S.A. until the 1910s [ 28]. Berberis thunbergii seeds are dispersed by birds and mammals, although expansion through vegetative growth is also common. Berberis thunbergii can tolerate both shade and drought; therefore, it could adapt to various environmental conditions, including wooded habitats, wetland and disturbed areas [ 28].
